discussion.content:
D - https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2114572 "If you still receive a 404 error try using https://localhost/Repository/Data/ManagementModelEntities.svc.
If this succeeds, you likely have a DNS problem.
If this fails then your IIS repository website is not operational.
If you connect to the site successfully but receive an application error, server error or REPO404 error you must troubleshoot the connectivity between IaaS web and SQL (SQL Server running, network connectivity is valid, DNS look up is successful between SQL and all components, MSDTC, service account has DBO rights on database, etc.).
Additional logging for troubleshooting can be found in the Windows Event Logs and in the repository.log located in the installation directory ( \VMware\vCAC\Server\Model Manager Web\Logs\Repository.log)."

It should be C.

According to the link: https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2114572

https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2114572

...as the article linked by the question doesn't mention logs at all.

Still D.

questions.question_text: To which log would an administrator refer discover a reason for a 404 not found in the infrastructure tab in vRealize Automation?

discussion.content:
Correct: From linked article

The endpoint name you configure in vRealize Automation must match the endpoint name provided to the vSphere proxy agent during installation

choices.A: Validate that the vSphere (vCenter) endpoint name matches the name of the DEM Worker.
choices.C: Restart the IaaS Manager Server service.
choices.D: Validate that the vSphere (vCenter) endpoint name matches the name of the vSphere Proxy Agent service.

discussion.content:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.6/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-EFC696D5-6320-4E5D-8DD5-84D362284E5D.html

Using vRealize CloudClient, log in to the vRealize Automation appliance as a user with software architect and infrastructure architect privileges.

B and E. 
I guess, because the infrastructure architect is mainly for the machine blueprints.
This appears to be correct. Looking at the roles these are the only two that allow for creation of blueprints.

choices.D: Directly from vSphere inventory through API

questions.question_text: When importing machines into vRealize Automation, how is the list of machines populated into the csv file?

comments.content: This looks like a manual process to me (B). I could be wrong

discussion.content:
D is correct answer.

Procedure
a.Generate a virtual machine CSV data file.
b.Select Infrastructure > Administration > Bulk Imports.
c.Click Generate CSV File.
...

A and E is correct

A: https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/7.6/com.vmware.vra.prepare.use.doc/GUID-C019D6EE-7C53-4FDD-94C6-C60DAE675B2E.html#GUID-C019D6EE-7C53-4FDD-94C6-C60DAE675B2E
